title: NLL: unexpected panic when running test

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

milestone.title: NLL: Valid code works
milestone.description: Fix all known ICEs or other cases where code that *ought* to compile does not

body:
Compiler unexpectedly panicked when running test [borrowck-for-loop-correct-cmt-for-pattern.rs](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/26e881d00fee7f28bdb7f0562dbcb7f24db43d1a/src/test/compile-fail/borrowck/borrowck-for-loop-correct-cmt-for-pattern.rs) with `rustc 1.23.0-nightly (5041b3bb3 2017-11-19)`.
``` $ rustc -Znll src/test/compile-fail/borrowck/borrowck-for-loop-correct-cmt-for-pattern.rs warning: unused variable: `a` --> src/test/compile-fail/borrowck/borrowck-for-loop-correct-cmt-for-pattern.rs:22:10 | 22 | for &a in x.iter() { //~ ERROR cannot move out | ^ | = note: #[warn(unused_variables)] on by default = note: to avoid this warning, consider using `_a` instead warning: unused variable: `a` --> src/test/compile-fail/borrowck/borrowck-for-loop-correct-cmt-for-pattern.rs:28:10 | 28 | for &a in &f.a { //~ ERROR cannot move out | ^ | = note: to avoid this warning, consider using `_a` instead warning: unused variable: `a` --> src/test/compile-fail/borrowck/borrowck-for-loop-correct-cmt-for-pattern.rs:32:10 | 32 | for &a in x.iter() { //~ ERROR cannot move out | ^ | = note: to avoid this warning, consider using `_a` instead error[E0507]: cannot move out of borrowed content --> src/test/compile-fail/borrowck/borrowck-for-loop-correct-cmt-for-pattern.rs:22:9 | 22 | for &a in x.iter() { //~ ERROR cannot move out | ^- | || | |hint: to prevent move, use `ref a` or `ref mut a` | cannot move out of borrowed content error[E0507]: cannot move out of borrowed content --> src/test/compile-fail/borrowck/borrowck-for-loop-correct-cmt-for-pattern.rs:28:9 | 28 | for &a in &f.a { //~ ERROR cannot move out | ^- | || | |hint: to prevent move, use `ref a` or `ref mut a` | cannot move out of borrowed content error[E0507]: cannot move out of borrowed content --> src/test/compile-fail/borrowck/borrowck-for-loop-correct-cmt-for-pattern.rs:32:9 | 32 | for &a in x.iter() { //~ ERROR cannot move out | ^- | || | |hint: to prevent move, use `ref a` or `ref mut a` | cannot move out of borrowed content error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports note: rustc 1.23.0-nightly (5041b3bb3 2017-11-19) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` for a backtrace thread 'rustc' panicked at 'LocalTableInContext: key not found', /checkout/src/libcore/option.rs:874:4 note: Some details are omitted, run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` for a verbose backtrace. stack backtrace: 0: std::sys::imp::backtrace::tracing::imp::unwind_backtrace at /checkout/src/libstd/sys/unix/backtrace/tracing/gcc_s.rs:49 1: std::sys_common::backtrace::_print at /checkout/src/libstd/sys_common/backtrace.rs:68 2: std::panicking::default_hook::{{closure}} at /checkout/src/libstd/sys_common/backtrace.rs:57 at /checkout/src/libstd/panicking.rs:381 3: std::panicking::default_hook at /checkout/src/libstd/panicking.rs:391 4: std::panicking::rust_panic_with_hook at /checkout/src/libstd/panicking.rs:577 5: std::panicking::begin_panic at /checkout/src/libstd/panicking.rs:538 6: std::panicking::begin_panic_fmt at /checkout/src/libstd/panicking.rs:522 7: rust_begin_unwind at /checkout/src/libstd/panicking.rs:498 8: core::panicking::panic_fmt at /checkout/src/libcore/panicking.rs:71 9: core::option::expect_failed at /checkout/src/libcore/option.rs:874 10: as core::ops::index::Index>::index 11: rustc_mir::transform::nll::free_regions::free_regions 12: rustc_mir::transform::nll::compute_regions 13: rustc_mir::borrow_check::do_mir_borrowck 14: >::with 15: rustc::ty::context::GlobalCtxt::enter_local 16: _ZN9rustc_mir12borrow_check12mir_borrowck17hd2e1eca39abe2434E.llvm.20954609 17: rustc::ty::maps::>::compute_result 18: _ZN5rustc9dep_graph5graph8DepGraph14with_task_impl17hdca1bda1b737f230E.llvm.7DE9159C 19: rustc_errors::Handler::track_diagnostics 20: rustc::ty::maps::plumbing::>::cycle_check 21: rustc::ty::maps::>::force 22: rustc::ty::maps::>::try_get 23: rustc::ty::maps::TyCtxtAt::mir_borrowck 24: rustc::ty::maps::>::mir_borrowck 25: _ZN12rustc_driver6driver27phase_3_run_analysis_passes28_$u7b$$u7b$closure$u7d$$u7d$28_$u7b$$u7b$closure$u7d$$u7d$17h9f2d943c7a15a43cE.llvm.ABDECBA6 26: >::with 27: >::with 28: rustc::ty::context::TyCtxt::create_and_enter 29: rustc_driver::driver::compile_input 30: rustc_driver::run_compiler ```

It seems to compile okay with `rustc 1.22.0-nightly (f1b5225e8 2017-10-01)` however. ``` $ rustc -V --verbose rustc 1.23.0-nightly (5041b3bb3 2017-11-19) binary: rustc commit-hash: 5041b3bb3d953a14f32b15d1e41341c629acae12 commit-date: 2017-11-19 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.23.0-nightly LLVM version: 4.0 ```
